quoteLast: on the 9th the attack began. In De Crespigny’s Brigade, the 2nd Battalion Grenadiers and 2nd Battalion Coldstream advanced after an intense bombardment, which lasted four minutes, and having crossed the stream with comparatively little difficulty secured the first objective.
title: The Grenadier Guards in the Great War of 1914-1918, Vol. 2 of 3
author: Ponsonby, Frederick, 1867-1935

quoteLast: on September 27th; but as the 3rd Division on the left and the 5th Division on the right would advance along higher ground than the 42nd, it was arranged that the 42nd should not move until these divisions had had time to make good the higher ground on its flanks.

quoteLast: I had also to clean most of the little engine, the driver doing part. I had to clean up the shed, take all ashes out, coke the tender, etc.

quoteFirst: {188} The doomed cities, accordingly, contained on the fatal day a large number of guests, and were emptied, at the same time, of large numbers of their residents; but the merry-making of the previous days had induced later slumbers, generally, on that dread Monday morning, and few had risen from their beds when the shock came which buried them in the ruins of their dwellings. It shook Messina at
quoteLast: o’clock, long before day had begun to dawn. The late F. Marion Crawford, who wrote, three months after the occurrence, for _The Outlook_, a carefully prepared account of it, derived from personal inquiries and investigations on the spot, describes the overwhelming moment thus:
title: History for ready reference, Volume 7
author: Larned, J. N. (Josephus Nelson), 1836-1913

quoteFirst: The boy aged 9 has been working two years, the boy aged 8 has been working three years; the boy aged 7 years has been working two years. These little fellows work 13 hours a day, from
quoteLast: to 6:30 P. M., with twenty minutes for dinner. In ‘rush’ periods their mill works until 9:30 and 10 P. M. They were refused a holiday for Thanksgiving and they obtained Christmas Day only by working till 7 P. M. in order to make up the time.
title: The industrial republic: a study of the America of ten years hence
author: Sinclair, Upton, 1878-1968
